result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan John Satterlund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 56 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan John Satterlund

defendant.name: Satterlund, Nathan John

records.addlTxt: e: DA, Atty Erdman, and DOC   c: DE and SCSO   arc
Restitution hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

4:21 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon via zoom, Clerk: S. Fox, Defendant Nathan John Satterlund in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Nathan John Satterlund.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes Pleas 22CF608, and 22CT175 and 22CM452, 22CM579  - INIT/Pleas. There is an agreement. Defendant waives right to a Preliminary Hearing in case 22CF608. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in case 22CF608. 
Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 -  in 22CF608, Criminal Damage to property. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF608, Criminal damage to property. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 22CM452, 22CM579 and 22CT175. Joint recommendation. Crt orders: 

Count 1 in 22CF608: S/W 2 years probation (concurrent with any other sentences)  with conditions: 

- No Contact with A. Mullins
- Comply with Mental Health treatment including appointments and take prescribed medications. 
- Absolute sobriety
- Subject to random testing to monitor sobriety compliance by DOC agent. 
- $3486.50 in restitution payable to St. Croix County Jail/SCSO
- DNA Sample
- $268 court costs, payable through Clerk of court - Reduce to a civil judgment
- $250 DNA surcharge, payable through Clerk of court - Reduce to a civil judgment. 

Restitution hearing to be held re: ability to pay hearing. 
56 days credit against ultimate sentence
Adjourned at 4:40 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
to reschedule hearing. Filed by Atty. Erdman. kma   to rg

8:00 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nathan John Satterlund in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF608, 22CM452, 22CM579 & 22CT175.  Court reviews files and questions ADA Ellenwood as to what the status is and if she's heard from Atty Erdman regarding these matters.  ADA Ellenwood did speak with DE and believes she can get these matters resolved quickly.  Court reviews DE's rights for an attorney. DE states he would like to represent himself.  DE makes statements and argument. Court directs DE to contact PD if he has questions on his cases.  For today Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel and is competent to represent himself.  ADA Ellenwood will have an offer to DE today.  Court schedules PLEAS for next week, DE to reach out to PD if still has questions.  Adjourned at 8:16 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

AMENDED

INCLUDES 22CF608, 22CM579, 22CT175, & 22CM452

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Allison Mullen.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license or IID installed.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device and cannot be within 1,000 yards of Allison Mullen's residence or place of employment. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

9:00 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nathan John Satterlund in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF608, 22CM452, 22CM579, & 22CT175. Court reviews DE's rights to having a counsel appointed. DE makes statements and at this time does not want an attorney.  Court notes Atty Erdman is in the court room for a different matter.  Atty Erdman asks to have a minute in holding with DE to discuss matters.  OFF Record at 9:12 AM. Back ON RECORD at 9:14 AM.  Atty Erdman states she will take DE as a client and asks to schedule matter in a week to allow time for her to review case and to negotiate with the State, also asking to modify bond.  Court modifies bond and adds all cases to new bond. DE to contact PD's office and ask to have Atty Erdman appointed. Adjourned at 9:19 AM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 11, 2022 at 08:00 am.
